org.dellroad.stuff.schema
Class SQLUpdate

java.lang.Object
  org.dellroad.stuff.schema.AbstractSchemaUpdate
      org.dellroad.stuff.schema.SQLUpdate
All Implemented Interfaces:
SchemaModification, SchemaUpdate
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpringSQLUpdate
public class SQLUpdate
extends AbstractSchemaUpdate

Update that executes a provided SQL script.

The script may contain multiple SQL statements, in which case individual statements will be parsed out and executed individually in order. However,this requires proper configuration of a split pattern.

Method Detail

setSQLScript

public void setSQLScript(String sqlScript)
Configure the SQL script. This is a required property.

Parameters:
sqlScript - script containing one or more SQL statements; if more than one statement is present, a split pattern must also be configured
See Also:
setSplitPattern()

setSplitPattern

public void setSplitPattern(String splitPattern)
Set the split pattern used to split apart a script containing multiple SQL statements into individual statements. If this property is not set, the script is assumed to contain a single SQL statement.

For example, assuming statements are terminated by semi-colons and each SQL statement starts on a new line, a reasonable setting would be ";[ \t\r]*\n\s+".

Throws:
PatternSyntaxException - if the pattern is not a valid Java regular expression

           throws SQLException
